text:
Late-night soup and a tense atmosphere.  
Nastasya leans in, whispering.  
Nastasya: “Praskovya wants to complain to the police.”  

Raskolnikov scowls, anger brewing.  
Raskolnikov: “To the police? What does she want?”  
Nastasya: “You owe her money and won’t leave!”  

Raskolnikov grinds his teeth, frustration boiling.  
Raskolnikov: “The devil, that’s the last straw!”  
Nastasya: “Why do you lie here doing nothing?”  

Raskolnikov hesitates, defensive.  
Raskolnikov: “I am doing…”  
Nastasya bursts into laughter, shaking uncontrollably.  
Nastasya: “Have you made money by your thinking?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is confronted by Nastasya about his lack of action and financial troubles, leading him to defensively claim he is "thinking" as his work.
